edu.stanford.scs.difc

Class Label<L extends Label<L>>

    • edu.stanford.scs.difc.Label<L>

    public abstract class Label<L extends Label<L>>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class describing the operations that can be performed on any Label.

    • Method Detail

      • canFlowTo

        public abstract boolean canFlowTo(L otherLabel)
        Can-flow-to relation (⊑). An entity labeled l1 should be allowed to affect an entity l2 only if l1.canFlowTo(l2). This relation on labels is at least a partial order, and satisfies the following laws:
        1. Reflexivity: l1.canFlowTo(l1) for any l1.
        2. Antisymmetry: If l1.canFlowTo(l2) and l2.canFlowTo(l1) then l1.equals(l2).
        3. Transitivity: If l1.canFlowTo(l2) and l2.canFlowTo(l3) then l1.canFlowTo(l3).

      • leastUpperBound

        public abstract L leastUpperBound(L other)
        Compute the least upper bound, or join, of two labels. When data carrying two different labels is mixed together in a document, the least upper bound of the two labels is the lowest safe value with which to label the result.
        More formally, for any two labels l1 and l2, if ljoin = l1.leastUpperBount(l2), it must be that:
        1. l1.canFlowTo(ljoin)
        2. l2.canFlowTo(ljoin)
        3. There is no label l /= ljoin such that l1.canFlowTo(l), l2.canFlowTo(l), and l.canFlowTo(ljoin).
        In other words ljoin is the least element to which both l1 and l2 can flow.

      • greatestLowerBound

        public abstract L greatestLowerBound(L other)
        Greatest lower bound, or meet, of two labels. For any two labels l1 and l2, if lmeet = l1.greatestLowerBound(l2), it must be that:
        1. lmeet.canFlowTo(l1)
        2. lmeet.canFlowTo(l2)
        3. There is no label l != lmeet such that l.canFlowTo(l1), l.canFlowTo(l2), and lmeet.canFlowTo(l).
        In other words lmeet is the greatest element flowing to both l1 and l2.

      • lub

        public final L lub(L other)
        Alias for leastUpperBound

      • glb

        public final L glb(L other)
        Alias for greatestLowerBound
